text: Anyone here an expert on weather data? I'm trying to find a dataset of historical weather forecasts in the US (say 5-day forecasts at the county level or something) and not finding much. Lots of historical actualized weather data, but not much in the way of forecasts.

elements.text: Anyone here an expert on weather data? I'm trying to find a dataset of historical weather forecasts in the US (say 5-day forecasts at the county level or something) and not finding much. Lots of historical actualized weather data, but not much in the way of forecasts.

text:
I am pretty sure NOAA. has them somewhere.

Possibly these are them
<https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/data-access/model-data/model-datasets/north-american-mesoscale-forecast-system-nam|https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/data-access/model-data/model-datasets/north-american-mesoscale-forecast-system-nam>

attachments.title: North American Mesoscale Forecast System (NAM) | National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI) formerly known as National Climatic Data Center (NCDC)
attachments.text: The North American Mesoscale Forecast System is a major weather model that produces forecasts for dozens of weather parameters.
attachments.fallback: North American Mesoscale Forecast System (NAM) | National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI) formerly known as National Climatic Data Center (NCDC)

elements.text:
I am pretty sure NOAA. has them somewhere.

Possibly these are them

attachments.title: Numerical Weather Prediction | National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI) formerly known as National Climatic Data Center (NCDC)
attachments.text: Numerical Weather Prediction processes current weather observations through computer model software to forecast the future state of weather.
attachments.fallback: Numerical Weather Prediction | National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI) formerly known as National Climatic Data Center (NCDC)

text: Yeah - I was looking through these but it seemed like to get a decent historical dataset you'd have to crawl a lot of different subpages and append them all together. Was hoping to avoid that, but it might be the best option. Thanks for the tips!

elements.text: Yeah - I was looking through these but it seemed like to get a decent historical dataset you'd have to crawl a lot of different subpages and append them all together. Was hoping to avoid that, but it might be the best option. Thanks for the tips!

text:
There might be another place for them.
NOAA has a bunch of FTP servers where everything goes.
There is I think easy ways to download FTP recursively.

But also Cascadia + HTTP.jl + asyncs make short work of crawling <https://github.com/Algocircle/Cascadia.jl|https://github.com/Algocircle/Cascadia.jl>
